name: lmodcmn

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, ccmn), wcel(c0, cabl))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ LMod, c0 ∈ CMnd, c0 ∈ Abel)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, ccmn))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c0, ccmn))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ CMnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Abel → c0 ∈ CMnd)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, ccmn))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c0, ccmn))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ CMnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Abel → c0 ∈ CMnd)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, ccmn))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c0, ccmn))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ CMnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Abel → c0 ∈ CMnd)

comment: A left module is a commutative monoid under addition. (Contributed by NM, 7-Jan-2015.)
